byline.contributor: Declan Walsh reported from London, and Zia ur-Rehman from Karachi, Pakistan.
byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and ZIA ur-REHMAN

abstract: Pakistani civilian and military authorities in Karachi are attacking city's powerful political leader Altaf Hussain, who is living in self-imposed exile in London; moves against him and his Muttahida Qaumi Movement are part of effort to control violence in volatile city.
lead_paragraph: The moves against Altaf Hussain and his Muttahida Qaumi Movement party are part of an effort to stem the cycle of violence that has plagued Karachi.

headline.main: Loosening a Party’s Grip on Karachi, a Pakistani City Known for Violence
headline.print_headline: A Once Untouchable Leader’s Grip Is Slipping

snippet: The moves against Altaf Hussain and his Muttahida Qaumi Movement party are part of an effort to stem the cycle of violence that has plagued Karachi.
